gw.transaction

Interface BundleTransactionCallbackExt


  • public interface BundleTransactionCallbackExt
    Optional interface that allows implementations of BundleTransactionCallback to receive the exception thrown (if any) in the afterCommit(Bundle, boolean, Exception) callback method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void afterCommit(Bundle bundle, boolean commitSucceeded, java.lang.Exception exception)
      Called as the last step in the commit process.

    • Method Detail

      • afterCommit

        void afterCommit(Bundle bundle,
                 boolean commitSucceeded,
                 java.lang.Exception exception)
        Called as the last step in the commit process. By the time afterCommit is called, the list of bundle transaction callbacks is removed from the current bundle. If you need to re-add a callback to the bundle, re-add this callback : bundle.addBundleTransactionCallback(this)

        This method is an alternative to BundleTransactionCallback.afterCommit(Bundle, boolean). If the framework would call BundleTransactionCallback.afterCommit(Bundle, boolean), and the callback is an instance of this interface, then the framework will call this method instead.

        WARNING: Modifications to beans in the bundle at or after this event are forbidden.

        Parameters:
        bundle - the bundle being committed
        commitSucceeded - True if the commit succeeded, which means that data has been persisted in the DB and the global cache is coherent with the DB. Note that coherent means only that the cache will not have data in it that is incorrect with respect to the DB. An empty cache satisfies this definition.
        exception - in the case that the commit or any subsequent processing failed, the exception raised will be passed here.
